page.title: 18Relaxing in Hunton
page.content: The{Quoits Club }was formed in 1978. There are 23 members. From May onwards they play on Mondays and Wednesdays. They are in the Zetland and Lower Dale Leagues.In 1984 they were Zetland 2nd division champions. They travel north to Bowes or as far south as Sowerby. 38 games have been played this year. My family moved into the{New Inn }in 1984.My Dad used to be a policeman but now he is a landlord. He and Mum serve drinks, English and European lunches and suppers. My Mum won a trophy this year for making German food. Customers enjoy playing darts and dominoes. Louise's grandad was the publican of the {"Odd Fellows Arms" }for 28 years. In 1984 it was renovated by new owners and became the{Countryman's Inn.}There are five guest rooms. Lunchtime and evening meals are served and there are the usual pub games and teams.
